meanings.definition: Of or relating to the river Styx in Greek mythology.
meanings.sent1: The stygian waters of the river Styx flowed silently.
meanings.sent2: The boatman ferried souls across the stygian river.
meanings.sent3: The stygian mist around the river Styx made it hard to see where you were going.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like the stygian depths of the river Styx, dark and unending.
meanings.sent5: The stygian aura of the river Styx instilled fear in all who approached.

meanings.definition: Dark, gloomy, or hellish in nature.
meanings.sent1: The stygian cave was a place of eternal darkness.
meanings.sent2: The night was so stygian that even the stars seemed to hide.
meanings.sent3: The stygian mood at the party made everyone feel uneasy.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a stygian labyrinth of despair and doubt.
meanings.sent5: The stygian clouds loomed overhead, casting a shadow over the land.
